issues.description: When DDOT redesigned the lanes on 35th just south of Reservoir, it created a turning lane and narrowed the southbound lane. Now the southbound lane is not wide enough for a car (per DDOT standards of a 9-10 foot lane width minimum) when cars are parked in the zone 2 parking spaces on the southbound side. Either some parking spaces need to be removed or the turning lane needs to be redesigned. When cars are parked in the southbound parking spaces, the southbound traffic lane is 5-6 feet wide (tops!) . Buses, trucks and most cars can't make this turn.

issues.description: Parking really needs to be not allowed on this narrow segment of Connecticut Avenue, NW. Every single day cars park here after rush hour and it is only a two lane road to begin with here. When they park it becomes a one lane road and people dangerously merge to avoid hitting the cars. The cars come as a surprise because nobody in their right mind would expect a major road like Connecticut Avenue to become one lane so abruptly. Please take a look at this segment on both sides and place No Parking At Anytime signs. Bikers nearly get killed everyday and I have personally witnessed several accidents due to cars switching lanes due to the parked cars blocking traffic.
issues.address: 2126 Connecticut Avenue Northwest Washington, District of Columbia
